Schedule Advising Appointments through OneDePaul. Bio and Research Information As the Division Director of Human-Computer Interaction and Computer Graphics, Dr. Wolfe was instrumental in establishing DePaulâ€™s degree programs in Human-Computer Interaction, and Computer Graphics and Animation. After earning a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Indiana University, she was a NASA fellow at the Johnson Space Center, served on various committees of ACM SIGCSE and SIGGRAPH, held fellowships at Sony Imageworks, University of Hamburg, is a Fulbright Scholar and the team lead for the American Sign Language Project. Research Area Computer Graphics, Human Computer Interaction Specific Research Area Character animation to support communication between Deaf and hearing communities; accessibility; Graphics pedagogy Professional Associations ACM SIGGRAPH, ACM SIGCSE, National Association of the Deaf Schedule for Winter 2025-2026 Not available Courses Taught at DePaul CSC 241 Introduction to Computer Science I CSC 373 Computer Systems I CSC 399 Independent Study CSC 599 Independent Study CSC 690 Research Seminar CSC 695 Master's Research CSC 699 Research CSC 701 Full-Time Candidacy Continuation CSC 702 Part-Time Candidacy Continuation GAM 399 Independent Study GD 399 Independent Study HCI 440 Introduction to User-Centered Design HCI 460 Usability Evaluation Methods HCI 590 Topics in Human-Computer Interaction HCI 599 Independent Study IS 324 Enterprise Architecture IS 424 Enterprise Infrastructure IS 436 Social Marketing and Social Networking Applications IS 455 Electronic Business IT 231 Web Development I IT 300 Research Experience UXD 390 Special Topics in User Experience Design Course Evaluations ECT 455 -
